alert.note: Alert for Jones; Nolan (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 04 at 2:14AM CDT until June 05 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Fisher, Jones, Nolan and Taylor. * WHEN...Until 515 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 209 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow moving thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sweetwater, Hamlin, Roscoe, Blackwell, Nolan, Merkel, Rotan, Tuscola, Roby, Buffalo Gap, Trent, Lawn, Longworth, Noodle, Sylvester, Maryneal, Neinda. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 230 and 271. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... US 180 crossing 7 miles west of Roby, SH 70 crossing The Draw Southeast of Rotan, many frontage roads along IH 20 between Merkel and Sweetwater, FM 611 crossing 7 miles west of Rotan, FM 611 crossing 1 mile west of Rotan, and FM 89 crossing Scott Hollow.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
